report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.08.0]
**INSTITUTION PALLIATIVE CARE PROGRESS NOTE - - - - - DATE: **DATE[Nov 03 2009] - - - - - Chief Complaint: Dyspnea and depression - - - - - SUBJECTIVE SYMPTOMS Physical: Patient c/o generalized discomfort and pain. Experiences dyspnea following conversation ( with speaking valve in place ) after 10 minutes. Generalized weakness Psychological: Patient states she is tired of being in the hospital and confined to bed unable to eat or even hold things in her hands without dropping them. Goals of care: Patient wishes to stop all treatments and pursue hospice care in an inpatient unit closer to home.; Discussed goals of care with patient. She has a clear understanding of her disabilites. Informed us that she was "an athletic person" and cannot tolerate living life with a prosthesis on HD and being unable to eat. She states that she has been trying to proceed with recommended care in hopes of improving but does not feel that she will be able to reach a quality of life that is acceptable to her. **NAME[BBB] defines quality of life as being independent physically without a prosthesis not being on HD and being able to eat and drink what she wants. **NAME[BBB] has worked as a hospice volunteer before her MI and possess a good understanding of hospice value and goals. **NAME[CCC BBB] would prefer to be closer to home in **PLACE NY for her inpatient hospice care. Another concern **NAME[BBB] expressed is that her symptoms could be managed at EOL. She was afraid that support would simply be pulled and she could not recieve medications. I assured her that we or her hospice team would be sure to manage symptoms of pain dyspnea and emotional distress at end of life. **NAME[BBB] requested that we talk with her family and primary team about her decision. **NAME[VVV] Walk Palliative care SW is to speak with patient's husband this afternoon and hopefully meet with them over the weekend. I have spoken with **NAME[UUU] the nurse practitioner from the primary team who is to relay the content of our conversation to Dr. **NAME[XXX]. I also assured **NAME[UUU] that Palliative care would take the lead in coordinating transfer to an inpatient hospice for **NAME[BBB] closer to her home in **PLACE NY. We will continue to talk with the primary to keep them update with our progress. REC: My recommendation would be no elevation of care. Allow patient to refuse care as she deems appropriate. Plan: **NAME[VVV] Walk to meet with patient's husband on Sunday **DATE[Nov 5]th. Palliative care will continue to follow the patient to coordinate transfer to inpatient hospice facility and manage symptoms at EOL. Family Issues: Patient states that initially her husband and son were trying to convince her to continue therapy and try to rehab but now they are supportive of her decision to pursue comfort care. - - - - - Medications: Rounding Report: ACTIVE INPATIENT MEDICATION ORDERS amiodarone 200mg By Mouth Daily aspirin 81mg Duotube Daily bacitracin topical (Baciguent... 1Application Topically BID balsam Peru/castor oil/trypsi... 1Application Topically BID citalopram (Celexa) 30mg By Mouth QAM citalopram (Celexa) 40mg By Mouth QAM famotidine (Pepcid) 20mg By Mouth Daily ferrous sulfate 300mg By Mouth Daily fluconazole (Diflucan) 400mg By Mouth QMndWedFri heparin 5,000Unit(s) subQ Q8H insulin regular (HumuLIN R, NovoLIN... 0-20 Units subQ Q6H metoclopramide (Reglan) 10mg Duotube QID midodrine (Proamatine) 10mg Duotube TID multivitamin 5mL By Mouth Daily trazodone 50mg By Mouth AtBedtime ACTIVE INPATIENT PRN MED ORDERS acetaminophen (Tylenol) 650mg By Mouth Q6H lactulose 20gm By Mouth QID morphine 2mg IV Q3H ondansetron (Zofran) 4mg IV Q6H oxycodone 10mg By Mouth Q4H - - - - - REVIEW OF SYSTEMS: Modified Edmonton System Assessment Scale (ESAS): 1: Date:**DATE[Nov 03 2009]; Symptom(s): Pain: 1; Symptom(s): Tiredness (Fatigue): 3; Drowsiness (Sleepiness): 2; Depression: 1; Anxiety: 1; Nause: 1; Anorexia: 1; Shortness of Breath: 2; Secretions: Y; Constipation: N; Unable to respond: N; Delerium: N; Depression treated or referral made: Y; Goals discussion within 72 hours: Y; Primary team notified of recommendations: Y - - - - - GENERAL EXAM - Only document those organ systems that are medically necessary ----- VITALS: Rounding Report: VITALS: **DATE[Nov 03] 11:50 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 94 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 10:40 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 96 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 10:00 T: BP: 92/74 P: 84 RR: 18 SaO2: 96 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 08:00 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 95 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: VITALS TIME:**DATE[Nov 03 2009] 15:40 General Appearance: Patient appears older than stated age lying in hospital bed on 6D Skin: Skin turgor poor, tissue fragile. Large skin tear L upper arm HEENT: Moist mucosa; Hearing grossly normal; + Trach Bridled NG feeding tube. No evidence of thrush. Sclera anicteric Lymph: Not Examined Pulmonary: Scattered rales, diminished breath sounds bases Cardiac: Not Examined Abdomen: Soft; Nontender; BS Present Extremeties: Left AKA Right gangrenous toes 2+ edema Neuro: Awake, alert, oriented x3 Psych: Mood: Appropriate CAM: negative Musculoskeletal: Not Examined Genitalia: Not Examined Rectal/Pelvic: Not Examined Breasts: Not Examined - - - - - INVESTIGATION Labs: Reviewed - - - - - Rounding Report: ATTENDING:**NAME[XXX, WWW M] SERVICE:Cardiothoracic Surgery ISOLATION STATUS:VRE ALLERGIES:NKA ROUNDING REPORT TIME:**DATE[Nov 03 2009] 15:40 VITALS: **DATE[Nov 03] 11:50 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 94 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 10:40 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 96 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 10:00 T: BP: 92/74 P: 84 RR: 18 SaO2: 96 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: **DATE[Nov 03] 08:00 T: BP: P: RR: SaO2: 95 FiO2: 60 Ht: Wt: IO: (7a-3p) (3p-12a) (12a-7a) Total (7a-3p) (3p-12a) (12a-7a) INTAKE: 60 240 400 700 310 0 0 OUTPUT: 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 BALANCE: 60 240 400 700 310 0 0 MEDICATIONS: ACTIVE INPATIENT MEDICATION ORDERS amiodarone 200mg By Mouth Daily aspirin 81mg Duotube Daily bacitracin topical (Baciguent... 1Application Topically BID balsam Peru/castor oil/trypsi... 1Application Topically BID citalopram (Celexa) 30mg By Mouth QAM citalopram (Celexa) 40mg By Mouth QAM famotidine (Pepcid) 20mg By Mouth Daily ferrous sulfate 300mg By Mouth Daily fluconazole (Diflucan) 400mg By Mouth QMndWedFri heparin 5,000Unit(s) subQ Q8H insulin regular (HumuLIN R, NovoLIN... 0-20 Units subQ Q6H metoclopramide (Reglan) 10mg Duotube QID midodrine (Proamatine) 10mg Duotube TID multivitamin 5mL By Mouth Daily trazodone 50mg By Mouth AtBedtime ACTIVE INPATIENT PRN MED ORDERS acetaminophen (Tylenol) 650mg By Mouth Q6H lactulose 20gm By Mouth QID morphine 2mg IV Q3H ondansetron (Zofran) 4mg IV Q6H oxycodone 10mg By Mouth Q4H LABS: **DATE[Nov 03] 11:28 Glucose (bedside) 133 H Glu(Bedside Test) Meter **NAME[TTT]. RN Notified **DATE[Nov 03] 06:49 Glucose (bedside) 153 H **DATE[Nov 03] 04:00 Anion Gap 8.0 GFR (estimated) eGFR Na 135 C K 5.0 Cl 97 L CO2 30 BUN 39 H Cr 3.0 C Glucose 89 Ca 8.6 Mg 2.5 H WBC 9.4 RBC 2.63 L Hgb 8.0 L Hct 24.2 L MCV 92.1 RDW 18.5 H Platelets 304 Platelet Comments 1+ Platelets Enlarged Neutrophils 56 Bands 9 H Lymphs 8 L Monocytes 16 H Eosinophils 2 Basophils 0 Myelocytes 2 Metamyelocytes 7 Nucleated RBC 1 Type of Differential Manual Differential RBC Morphology 1+ Polychromasia 1+ Burr Cells WBC Morphology 1+ Toxic Granulation Present **DATE[Nov 02] 23:57 Glucose (bedside) 136 H **DATE[Nov 02] 17:47 Glucose (bedside) 123 H **DATE[Nov 02] 12:04 Glucose (bedside) 119 H **DATE[Nov 02] 04:16 Glucose (bedside) 139 H **DATE[Nov 02] 03:50 Anion Gap 13.0 H GFR (estimated) eGFR Na 138 K 4.3 Cl 98 CO2 27 BUN 25 Cr 2.2 H Glucose 103 H Ca 8.5 Mg 2.4 H Phos 2.3 L Fe 29 TIBC 210 L Fe Sat % 14 L Ferritin 649 H WBC 6.5 RBC 2.68 L Hgb 8.1 L Hct 24.7 L MCV 91.9 RDW 18.4 H Platelets 306 Neutrophils 38 L Bands 17 H Lymphs 8 L Monocytes 19 H Eosinophils 1 Basophils 0 Myelocytes 12 Metamyelocytes 5 Nucleated RBC 2 Type of Differential Manual Differential RBC Morphology 1+ Polychromasia PTH 40 **DATE[Nov 01] 23:56 Glucose (bedside) 151 H **DATE[Nov 01] 17:03 Glucose (bedside) 180 H MICROBIOLOGY: SPUTUM CULTURE(Sputum) 4/02. Gram Stain: Moderate WBCs present; Few Gram Positive Cocci in pairs; Few Gram Negative Rods Culture: Light Gram Negative Rods; Light STAPHYLOCOCCUS AUREUS; Normal oropharyngeal flora consisting of the following:; Light VIRIDANS STREPTOCOCCI [Prelim] GENITAL CULTURE(Vaginal) 4/02. Gram Stain: No WBCs present; Few Gram Positive Cocci in pairs Culture: Heavy ENTEROCOCCUS SPECIES; Light Gram Negative Rods [Prelim] DVT Prophylaxis:Heparin GT Prophylaxis:Famotidine ASSESSMENT AND PLAN - - - - - Problem/Diagnosis 1: RV failure s/p MI and VSD Problem/Diagnosis 2: RF Problem/Diagnosis 3: Altered Mental status; Assessment/Plans: Patient alert and oriented during our visit. No signs of delirium. Good concentration, able to follow complex train of thought. Good insight into decisions Problem/Diagnosis 4: Support; Assessment/Plans: Emotional support provided by Palliative care SW and myself regarding decisions for goals of care and how to achieve these goals. - - - - - RECOMMENDATIONS Physical Symptoms: No change in medication regime Psychiatric Symptoms: Patient is not delirious - - - - - HOUSE STAFF PHYSICIAN/OTHER SIGNATURE: Electronically signed by **NAME[YYY] **NAME[ZZZ], CRNP at 16:12; **NAME[ZZZ, YYY] ; 8511; **DATE[Nov 3 2009]; 16:12 - - - - -
